titleStmt.title: T. D. Tadlock to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6616

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Danville Boyle County Ky
To his Excellency
Thomas E Bramlett

your Petitioner Thomas Tadlock would state -- That at the last February Term of the Boyle Circuit Court he was fined fifty dollars for carrying a concealed a deadly weapon -- he states to you excellency That he did not carry a weapon in violation of Law that there were men who was his enemies & had threatened his life & had made an attempt to take his life by shooting at him he states further that he was away from home at the time unavoidably, or he could have made these facts appear -- wherefor he asks your excellency to remit said fine
subscribed & sworn to before me by Thomas Tadlock 19th June 1865

N R McMurry Notary Public
N R McMurry
we have no doubt the above statements are true
I know nothing of the facts in the case but very earnestly hope that the Govenor will remit the fine

J F Bell
W. R Orear

Boyle Cir Ct
vs
Thos D. Tadlock
$50
Concld. Weapons
27th June/65
